title: Rolling - role of friction on sphere down a ramp

content.prompt: A sphere is held at the top of a straight ramp. When released, the sphere rolls down the ramp without slipping. Which of the following claims about the force of friction, if any, is correct?

choices.label: There is a nonzero force of static friction exerted on the sphere that increases in magnitude as the rotation of the sphere increases.
There is a nonzero force of static friction exerted on the sphere that does not dissipate any mechanical energy.
There is a nonzero force of kinetic friction exerted on the sphere because the sphere is moving.
There is a nonzero force of kinetic friction exerted on the sphere that dissipates mechanical energy.

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
